intro: Microtis atrata, commonly known as the black-leafed microtis, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, commonly known as the orchid family. The plant is characterized by its narrow, dark green leaves and small, pale green flowers that bloom in spring. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Microtis atrata is often found in heathlands and forested areas, where it contributes to the ecological diversity of its habitat.
